text: Nordstromia fuscula is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Hong-Fu Chu and Lin-Yao Wang in 1988. It is found in the Chinese provinces of Sichuan and Fujian., 2010: Nordstromia guenterriedeli sp. n. from Sumatra (Indonesia) (Lepidoptera: Drepanidae). Entomofauna 0031: 57-68. Adults resemble Nordstromia fusca, but can be distinguished by the wing pattern and the male genitalia., 1988: On the Chinese Drepaninae (Lepidoptera: Drepanidae) genus Nordstroemia Bryk, 1943. Acta Entomologica Sinica 31 (3): 309-317. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1988 Category:Drepaninae Category:Moths of China
title: Nordstromia fuscula
